RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Border Patrol agents: Jorge Luis Trevino and Hugo Benavides

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ignacio Rodriguez: Defendant who testified about his interaction with Officer Reyes, was found to have questionable credibility by the undersigned
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Reymundo Reyes: Officer who conducted a search and testified about the events, had reasonable suspicion to detain Defendant until Border Patrol's arrival
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hugo Benavides: Agent who arrived at the scene, did not corroborate Officer Reyes's testimony about the camper
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.J. Scott Hacker: United States Magistrate Judge who considered the evidence presented in the case and gave little weight to the observation of the camper due to ambiguity surrounding its existence
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino and Hugo Benavides: Border Patrol agents who testified in the case, with Jorge Luis Trevino providing details about the black truck and camper, and Hugo Benavides not corroborating this testimony
